font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:12pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Core system conversion of Intermountain completed during the quarter</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:12pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Named </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:bold;">2015 Best of the South Sound and Top Places to Work by the Business Examiner</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:12pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;background-color:#ffffff;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Named one of  &#8220;Washington&#8217;s Best Workplaces&#8221; 2015 by the Puget Sound Business Journal</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">TACOMA, Washington, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">July&#160;23, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">-- Melanie Dressel, President and Chief Executive Officer of Columbia Banking System and Columbia Bank (NASDAQ: COLB) (&#8220;Columbia&#8221;) said today upon the release of Columbia&#8217;s </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;earnings, &#8220;We accomplished a lot this quarter, generating solid financial performance, especially in light of the after tax impact to earnings of $3.4 million, or $0.06 per diluted share, resulting from acquisition-related expense and FDIC acquired loan accounting. Despite intense competition, our bankers continue to expand existing and source new relationships. Their production of over $280 million in new loans represents our second highest quarterly total ever.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;1</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="s67B03A95A3DD2D2CA1ECFCE8A22C173F"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Ms. Dressel continued, &#8220;We completed the core operating system conversion for our latest acquisition during the quarter and are nearing the end of the integration process. The successful conversion was the result of the outstanding efforts of everyone involved to ensure there was minimal disruption to our customers and new team members.&#8221;</font></div><a name="s2E31ECE333AC13357594FCE8A24BFF32"></a><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Significant Influences on the Quarter Ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Balance Sheet</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Loans were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$5.61 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, up </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$161.0 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;due to robust originations during the current quarter. Securities were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.93 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, a decrease of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$113.9 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">6%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$2.04 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;primarily due to the reinvestment of cash flows into originated loans. Total deposits at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$7.04 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, a decrease of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$30.6 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$7.07 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. Core deposits were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$6.74 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, a decrease of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$33.8 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The average rate on interest-bearing deposits and total deposits for the quarter was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">0.08%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">0.04%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, respectively, compared to 0.07% and 0.04% for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Asset Quality</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">At </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, nonperforming assets to total assets were </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">0.54%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">0.65%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. Total nonperforming assets decreased </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$8.8 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;due to a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$6.1 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;reduction in nonaccrual loans and a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$2.7 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;decline in other real estate owned due to sales activity during the current quarter.</font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;2</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div conform to the current period&#8217;s presentation. The reclassification was limited to including charge-off, recovery, and provision activity related to the purchased credit impaired loan portfolio.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">The allowance for loan losses to period end loans was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">1.23%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">1.29%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. Excluding acquired loans, the allowance at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;represented </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">1.17%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;of originated loans, unchanged from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">March&#160;31, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The allowance to loans, excluding acquired loans, is a non-GAAP financial measure. See the section titled &#8220;Non-GAAP Financial Measures&#8221; on the last pages of this earnings release for the reconciliation of the allowance for loan losses to period end loans, excluding acquired loans. </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">For the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, Columbia recorded a net provision for loan and lease losses of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$2.2 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to a net provision of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$2.1 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the comparable quarter last year. The net provision for loan and lease losses recorded during the current quarter was primarily driven by the net charge-offs recorded during the quarter and growth in the loan portfolio, partially offset by improving asset quality metrics. </font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;4</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Net Interest Margin (&#8220;NIM&#8221;) </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Columbia&#8217;s net interest margin (tax equivalent) of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">4.41%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;increased 2 basis points from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">4.39%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. Compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, Columbia&#8217;s net interest margin decreased </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">45</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;basis points from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">4.86%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, primarily due to lower incremental accretion on acquired loans, which was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$11.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the prior year quarter, compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$7.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the current quarter. Columbia&#8217;s operating net interest margin (tax equivalent)</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:8pt">(1) </sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">4.17%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, relatively flat compared to 4.18% for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;and down 10 basis points compared to 4.27% for the second quarter of 2014 due as a result of the continuing low interest rate environment.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:12px;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">The following table shows the impact to interest income resulting from accretion of income on acquired loan portfolios as well as the net interest margin and operating net interest margin: </font></div><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">524</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px #000000;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(1,387</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:3px double #000000;padding-right:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #000000;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">)</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">The incremental accretion income on FDIC purchased credit impaired loans represents the amount of income recorded above the contractual rate stated in the individual loan notes and stems from the discount established at the time these loan portfolios were acquired. At </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, the accretable yield on purchased credit impaired loans was $67.3 million. Accretable yield is subject to change based upon expected future loan cash flows, which are remeasured by Columbia on a quarterly basis.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">The </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.5 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;change in the FDIC loss-sharing asset in the current quarter reduced noninterest income and consisted primarily of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.4 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in amortization expense. Additional details of the components of the change in the FDIC loss-sharing asset are provided in tabular format in the section titled &#8220;Noninterest Income&#8221; in the following pages.</font></div><a name="s667A41A879531994B048FCE8A28A87CE"></a><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;color:#000000;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Quarter </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:14pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-weight:bold;">&#32;Results </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Net Interest Income</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Net interest income for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$81.0 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, an increase of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$646 thousand</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. This increase was primarily due to higher average loan balances in the current quarter. Compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, net interest income increased by </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$5.9 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$75.1 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The increase from the prior year period is due to the combination of</font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;6</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;acquired loans and securities from the acquisition of Intermountain Community Bancorp (&#8220;Intermountain&#8221;) and organic loan growth, partially offset by a decline in incremental accretion income. For additional information regarding net interest income, see the &#8220;Average Balances and Rates&#8221; table.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Noninterest Income</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Total noninterest income was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$21.5 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, a decrease of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$22.8 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The linked quarter decline was primarily due to a $1.6 million negative variance related to the change in FDIC loss-sharing asset. For the prior quarter, the change in FDIC loss-sharing asset was a net benefit of $150 thousand, compared to a net expense in the current quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.5 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The net benefit in the linked quarter was due to increases in the asset resulting from loan impairment and OREO write-down activity. Additional details of the components of the change in the FDIC loss-sharing asset are provided in tabular format below. Also contributing to the linked quarter decrease in noninterest income was a reduction in investment securities gains, which were $378 thousand lower in the current quarter than in the first quarter of 2015. These decreases were partially offset by a $1.0 million increase in service charges and other fees compared to the first quarter of 2015.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, noninterest income increased by </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$6.8 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The increase from the prior year period was due to both a $2.1 million increase in service charges and other fees and the change in FDIC loss-sharing asset which was a net expense of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.5 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in the current quarter compared to an expense of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$5.1 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;in the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. The growth in service charges and other fees resulted primarily from the increased customer base from the acquisition of Intermountain. </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;7</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">The change in the FDIC loss-sharing asset has been a significant component of noninterest income. The following table reflects the income statement components of the change in the FDIC loss-sharing asset:</font></div><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Noninterest Expense</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Total noninterest expense for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$68.5 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, an increase of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$1.7 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$66.7 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. This increase was driven by higher acquisition-related expenses in the current quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$5.6 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$3.0 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">first</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. After taking into account the acquisition-related expenses, ongoing noninterest expense for the current quarter was $932 thousand lower than the first quarter of 2015 on the same basis.         Clint Stein, Columbia&#8217;s Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer stated, &#8220;With the Intermountain core system conversion behind us, the added costs associated with running multiple platforms has subsided and we have started to more fully realize the resulting efficiency in our expense numbers.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Compared to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of 2014, noninterest expense increased </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$10.7 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">19%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;from </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$57.8 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">, due to the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$5.0 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;increase in acquisition-related expenses as well as additional ongoing expense resulting from the Intermountain acquisition, partially offset by the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$563 thousand</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;benefit recorded in the current quarter related to OREO compared to a benefit of only </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">$97 thousand</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;recorded during the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter of 2014.</font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;8</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="sD742FEDC5D1567BBCB9DFCE8A2A9FAE1"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Organizational Update</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Melanie Dressel commented, &#8220;We were delighted that Columbia Bank was recently voted the &#8220;Best Large Business&#8221; 2015 by readers of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;">South Sound Magazine</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;during their annual poll. We were also named one of &#8220;Washington&#8217;s Best Workplaces&#8221; 2015 by the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;">Puget Sound Business Journal</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;for the ninth consecutive year. These awards are a true testament to our wonderful employees and their dedication to customer service. I was also very pleased and proud when Clint Stein was named a </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;">Puget Sound Business Journal</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;CFO of the year. The award celebrates financial executives in Washington whose leadership, guidance and knowledge contribute greatly to the success of their companies. Clint is certainly very deserving of the honor.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">Conference Call Information</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Columbia&#8217;s management will discuss the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">second</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;quarter </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;results on a conference call scheduled for Thursday, July 23, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. PDT (4:00 pm EDT). Interested parties may listen to this discussion by calling 1-866-378-3802; Conference ID code #22782056.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">A conference call replay will be available from approximately 4:00 p.m. PDT on July 23, 2015 through midnight PDT on July 30, 2015. The conference call replay can be accessed by dialing 1-855-859-2056 and entering Conference ID code #22782056.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">About Columbia</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Headquartered in Tacoma, Washington, Columbia Banking System, Inc. is the holding company of Columbia Bank, a Washington state-chartered full-service commercial bank, with over 150 branches throughout Washington, Oregon and Idaho.&#160;Columbia ranked 17th best on the 2015 </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;">Forbes</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;list of best banks in the country, as well as ranking the best in Washington and second in the Pacific Northwest for the fourth year in a row.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">More information about Columbia can be found on its website at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;color:#0000ff;text-decoration:underline;">www.columbiabank.com</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:center;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;"># # #</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">This news release includes forward looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, which management believes are a benefit to shareholders. These forward looking statements describe Columbia&#8217;s management&#8217;s expectations regarding future events and developments such as future operating results, growth in loans and deposits, continued success of Columbia&#8217;s style of banking and the strength of the local economy. The words &#8220;will,&#8221; &#8220;believe,&#8221; &#8220;expect,&#8221; </font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;9</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="sD742FEDC5D1567BBCB9DFCE8A2A9FAE1"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#8220;intend,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; and &#8220;anticipate&#8221; and words of similar construction are intended in part to help identify forward looking statements. Future events are difficult to predict, and the expectations described above are necessarily subject to risk and uncertainty that may cause actual results to differ materially and adversely. In addition to discussions about risks and uncertainties set forth from time to time in Columbia&#8217;s filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, available at the SEC&#8217;s website at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;color:#0000ff;text-decoration:underline;">www.sec.gov</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;and the Company&#8217;s website at www.columbiabank.com, including the &#8220;Risk Factors,&#8221; &#8220;Business&#8221; and &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; sections of our annual reports on Form 10-K and quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, factors that may cause actual results to differ materially from those contemplated by such forward-looking statements include, among others, the following:  (1) local, national and international economic conditions may be less favorable than expected or have a more direct and pronounced effect on Columbia than expected and adversely affect Columbia&#8217;s ability to continue its internal growth at historical rates and maintain the quality of its earning assets; (2) changes in interest rates may reduce interest margins more than expected and negatively affect funding sources; (3) projected business increases following strategic expansion or opening or acquiring new branches may be lower than expected; (4) costs or difficulties related to the integration of acquisitions may be greater than expected; (5) competitive pressure among financial institutions may increase significantly; and (6) legislation or regulatory requirements or changes may adversely affect the businesses in which Columbia is engaged. We believe the expectations reflected in our forward-looking statements are reasonable, based on information available to us on the date hereof. However, given the described uncertainties and risks, we cannot guarantee our future performance or results of operations and you should not place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements. We undertake no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. The factors noted above and the risks and uncertainties described in our SEC filings should be considered when reading any forward-looking statements in this release.</font></div><div The operating efficiency ratio (tax equivalent) is a non-GAAP financial measure. See section titled "Non-GAAP Financial Measures" on the last pages of this earnings release for the reconciliation of the operating efficiency ratio (tax equivalent) to the efficiency ratio (tax equivalent).</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><font The amortization of net deferred loan fees was $1.5 million and $1.2 million for the three months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively. Amortized net deferred loan fees and net unearned discounts on certain acquired loans were included in the interest income calculations. The amortization of net deferred loan fees was $2.6 million and $2.1 million for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively. The tax equivalent yield adjustment to interest earned on tax exempt securities was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">$3.0 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;for the </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">six</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-left:4px;padding-bottom:4px;text-align:left;padding-left:24px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;17</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="s29086125D4ECFA6D1B68FCE8A42F4D0B"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Non-GAAP Financial Measures</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company considers its operating net interest margin and operating efficiency ratios to be important measurements as they more closely reflect the ongoing operating performance of the Company. Despite the importance of the operating net interest margin and operating efficiency ratio to the Company, there are no standardized definitions for them and, as a result, the Company&#8217;s calculations may not be comparable with other organizations. Also, there may be limits in the usefulness of these measures to investors. As a result, the Company encourages readers to consider its consolidated financial statements in their entirety and not to rely on any single financial measure.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The following tables reconcile the Company&#8217;s calculation of the operating net interest margin and operating efficiency ratio:</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">__________</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">(1) Tax-exempt interest income has been adjusted to a tax equivalent basis. The amount of such adjustment was an addition to net interest income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">$2.3 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#160;and&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">$1.9 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#160;for the three months ended&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#160;and&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;color:#000000;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, and an addition to net interest income of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">$4.6 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#32;and </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">$3.8 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#32;for the six months ended </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">June&#160;30, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">&#160;and&#160;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">2014</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:9pt;">, respectively.</font></div><br><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;18</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="sF2F3114242B3371E573EFCE8A45E3B7C"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Non-GAAP Financial Measures - Continued</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The Company considers its ratio of allowance for loan and lease losses to period-end loans, excluding acquired loans to be an important measurement because it more closely reflects the ongoing allowance coverage and provides a ratio that is more comparable to other bank holding companies that have not had similar acquisitions. Despite the importance of this ratio to the Company, there are no standardized definitions for it and, as a result, the Company&#8217;s calculations may not be comparable with other organizations. Also, there may be limits in the usefulness of this measure to investors. As a result, the Company encourages readers to consider its consolidated financial statements in their entirety and not to rely on any single financial measure.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:18px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The following table reconciles the Company&#8217;s calculation of the allowance for loan and <a name="s26D38A1FBD6E5F7FA506FCE8A0680600"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">Exhibit 99.2</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;"><img src="logo1q2015a01.jpg" style="height:57px;width:520px;"></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:underline;">FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">July&#160;23, 2015</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;text-indent:336px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Contacts:</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;                                      </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Melanie J. Dressel,</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">President and </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Chief Executive Officer</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">(253) 305-1911</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Clint E. Stein, </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Executive Vice President </font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">and Chief Financial Officer</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">(253) 593-8304</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-weight:bold;">Columbia Banking System Announces Regular</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-weight:bold;">Cash Dividend of $0.18</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:14pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:14pt;font-weight:bold;">and Declares Special Cash Dividend of $0.16</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-weight:bold;">TACOMA, Washington---</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;Columbia Banking System, Inc. (NASDAQ: COLB) announced today that a quarterly cash dividend of $0.18 per common share and per common share equivalent for holders of preferred stock, will be paid on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">August&#160;19, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;to shareholders of record as of the close of business on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">August&#160;5, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">. </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">In addition, the Board of Directors declared a special cash dividend of $0.16 per common share, and per common share equivalent for holders of preferred stock, which will also be paid on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">August&#160;19, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;to shareholders of record as of the close of business on </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">August&#160;5, 2015</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Melanie Dressel, President and Chief Executive Officer noted, &#8220;We are pleased that our current capital position and our financial performance allows us to pay a special cash dividend for the sixth consecutive quarter.&#160; Along with our regular dividend, the special dividend constitutes a payout ratio of 89% for the quarter and a dividend yield of 4.1% based on the closing price on July 22, 2015.&#8221;</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">About Columbia</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">Headquartered in Tacoma, Washington, Columbia Banking System, Inc. is the holding company of Columbia Bank, a Washington state-chartered full-service commercial bank, with over 150 branches </font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><a name="s26D38A1FBD6E5F7FA506FCE8A0680600"></a><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div><br><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">throughout Washington, Oregon and Idaho.&#160;For the ninth consecutive year, the bank was named in 2015 as one of&#160;Puget Sound Business Journal's&#160;"Washington's&#160;Best Workplaces."&#160;Columbia&#160;ranked in the top 20 on the 2015 Forbes list of best banks in the country, as well as ranking the best in&#160;Washington&#160;and second in the Pacific Northwest for the fourth year in a row.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:232%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:232%;text-align:left;text-indent:48px;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">More information about Columbia can be found on its website at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;color:#0000ff;text-decoration:underline;">www.columbiabank.com</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">.</font></div><div style="line-height:232%;text-align:center;font-size:12pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:12pt;font-style:italic;"># # #</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;">Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">This news release includes forward looking statements within the meaning of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, which management believes are a benefit to shareholders. These forward looking statements describe Columbia's management's expectations regarding future events and developments such as future operating results, growth in loans and deposits, continued success of Columbia's style of banking and the strength of the local economy. The words &#8220;will,&#8221; &#8220;believe,&#8221; &#8220;expect,&#8221; &#8220;intend,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; and &#8220;anticipate&#8221; and words of similar construction are intended in part to help identify forward looking statements. Future events are difficult to predict, and the expectations described above are necessarily subject to risk and uncertainty that may cause actual results to differ materially and adversely.  In addition to discussions about risks and uncertainties set forth from time to time in Columbia's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, available at the SEC's website at </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;color:#0000ff;text-decoration:underline;">www.sec.gov</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and the Company's website at www.columbiabank.com, including the &#8220;Risk Factors,&#8221; &#8220;Business&#8221; and &#8220;Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; sections of our annual reports on Form 10-K and quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, factors that may cause actual results to differ materially from those contemplated by such forward-looking statements include, among others, the following:  (1) local, national and international economic conditions may be less favorable than expected or have a more direct and pronounced effect on Columbia than expected and adversely affect Columbia's ability to continue its internal growth at historical rates and maintain the quality of its earning assets; (2) changes in interest rates may reduce interest margins more than expected and negatively affect funding sources; (3) projected business increases following strategic expansion or opening or acquiring new branches may be lower than expected; (4) costs or difficulties related to the integration of acquisitions may be greater than expected; (5) competitive pressure among financial institutions may increase significantly; and (6) legislation or regulatory requirements or changes may adversely affect the businesses in which Columbia is engaged. We believe the expectations reflected in our forward-looking statements are reasonable, based on information available to us on the date hereof. However, given the described uncertainties and risks, we cannot guarantee our future performance or results of operations and you should not place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements. We undertake no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. The factors noted above and the risks and uncertainties described in our SEC filings should be considered when reading any forward-looking statements in this release.</font></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div><br><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br></font></div></div>	</body>
